JobFullDesc:
From the very beginning, OfferUp has believed that the right people united by the right mission can redefine the possible.
OfferUp is dedicated to changing the way people buy and sell in their communities. As the largest mobile marketplace for local buyers and sellers in the U.S., the company offers iOS and Android apps that make selling an item as easy as snapping a picture from your mobile device. Founded in April 2011, OfferUp is reinventing local commerce by helping consumers uncover value through simplicity and trust. In 2020, OfferUp combined with letgo to reach more than 20M monthly users.
OfferUp At a Glance

100M+ Downloads
20M+ monthly users
Top 5 Shopping app in App Store and Google Play Store for three years
15%+ of adults in several markets use OfferUp every month (LA, Miami, Phoenix, Seattle, Las Vegas, Riverside, Orlando)
OfferUp works directly with nearly 2,000 US law enforcement agencies to build trust in local communities

OfferUp is seeking an experienced business attorney to serve as Senior Corporate Counsel, Legal or Associate General Counsel; Director, Legal to support OfferUp’s fast-growing marketplace business. This role will report to the General Counsel and work collaboratively with the rest of the Legal Department. The OfferUp Legal Department is a client-focused group with a strong emphasis on providing exceptional legal advice and advancing the Company's business goals. This growing team values collaboration and high-quality work product and is dedicated to its members’ professional development.  
Responsibilities

Support OfferUp’s product teams by advising on legal and risk issues related to OfferUp services.
Provide strategic advice on a variety of consumer and business facing digital advertising products to ensure compliance with regulations and consumer protection laws.
Review products, features and initiatives to provide practical legal risk mitigation strategies for products across multiple jurisdictions, with an emphasis on legal issues related to the mobile app ecosystem. 
Negotiate and draft general business and commercial agreements such as licensing agreements, SaaS agreements, vendor agreements, and other technology services agreements.
Resolve issues that arise in OfferUp’s ongoing commercial relationships.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of document templates, alternate language playbooks, and internal resource documents.
Deliver training and guidance to employees on legal issues, best practices, and company policies.
Provide advice and counsel on employment law issues including policies, hiring, discipline, terminations, and pay/benefits. 
Provide day-to-day legal advice and assist with other legal matters as the need arises.
Lead outside counsel relationships as appropriate. 

Requirements

At least 5 years of relevant experience is required for the Senior Corporate Counsel role. 

Candidates with 9+ years of experience, preferably from a mix of law firm and inhouse roles, will be considered for the Associate General Counsel position. 

JD from an accredited law school and an active member of the WA bar.
Comfortable with a hybrid office schedule (minimum two days in the office every week). 
Must be enthusiastic and hard-working.
Team player who enjoys working with, supporting and building relationships with other attorneys and internal clients.
Ability to operate successfully in a fast-paced environment that places a high premium on excellence, execution, and teamwork.
Strong understanding of mobile apps, digital advertising and similar technologies. 
Experience in either privacy compliance or human resources is not required, but would be beneficial.
Demonstrated history of assessing and managing risk. 
Ability to work independently when necessary.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Flexibility to work in multiple legal disciplines to address the various needs of clients.
Strong analytical and organizational skills.
Able to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects at once.
